meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unsteady or shaky.
meanings.sent1: The wobbliness of the table made it unsafe to place fragile items on top.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the wobbliness of her knees as she stood up after sitting for a long time.
meanings.sent3: The wobbliness of the jelly on the plate made it look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The wobbliness of the bridge reminded him of a leaf swaying in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's wobbliness while learning to walk was endearing to watch.

meanings.definition: The tendency to wobble or sway.
meanings.sent1: The boat's wobbliness in the rough waters made everyone feel queasy.
meanings.sent2: The tree's wobbliness in the strong wind worried the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The wobbliness of the dancer's hips added a comical touch to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The wobbliness of the old swing set brought back memories of carefree childhood days.
meanings.sent5: The wobbliness of the compass needle confused the hiker trying to find the right direction.
